instructions: Place your mint into your right hand and give it a light slap.
Add mint and rest of ingredients to glass. Using a muddle lightly press down on the mint.
Add ice to Lewis bag and crush.
Add ice to glass about 3/4 full and stir with spoon
Top off glass with ice and garnish with handfull of mint sprigs.
Mint Julep.notes: I used the iconic Julep glass, but a rocks glass works too. Double the simple syprup if you like it sweeter..

instructions: Place all ingredients into a shaker.
Add ice to shaker and shake your drink for 12-15 seconds.
Add ice or large ice cube to rocks glass and strain cocktail into glass.
Garnish with a lemon widge or twist.
Add ingredients to mixing glass.
Add ice and stire for 30 seconds.
Strain cocktail into coupe or Martini glass.
Garnish with cherry or orange peel.
Manhattan.notes: I'm pretty sure I made this into a pitcher by multiplying the ingredients by 10.

instructions: Place all ingredients into a shaker without ice.
Dry shake (no ice) for 30 seconds.
Add ice to shaker and shake your drink for 8-10 seconds.
Double strain into coupe or Martini glass.
Garnish with Angostura bitter drops on top.
Whiskey Sour.notes: If you can't stand the idea of egg white, most bartenders just leave it off. You can also Aquafaba.

instructions: Place all ingredients except strawberry syrup into glass with ice.
Stir for 10 seconds.
Stir in strawberry syrup to preference. I usually like 1-2 oz.
Ada Shelby.notes: This is Lindsay's version, which is different than the Peaky Blinders cocktail book. The book also calls for Sexton, but I usually use Bushmills or Tullamore Dew.

instructions: Put all ingredients, except Sprite, into cocktail shaker with ice.
Shake for 10-15 seconds.
Strain over ice into a tumbler or high ball glass.
Top off with Sprite
Green Irish Tea.notes: You'll find most receipes online are for shots, but the key is the 1:1:1 ratio of ingredients and top with Sprite. To make homemade Sweet & Sour mix, do equal parts water, sugar, lemon juice and lime juice.
